content.paragraph: This document outlines the crew procedure for a pre-ride bicycle check, ensuring rider safety and optimal performance. It details the steps for inspecting critical components and performing necessary adjustments.
content.heading: 1. Introduction
content.paragraph: This document outlines the crew procedure for a pre-ride bicycle check, ensuring rider safety and optimal performance. It details the steps for inspecting critical components and performing necessary adjustments.
content.heading: 2. Crew Procedure Steps
2.1. 1. Brakes

list.item: Inspect brake pads for wear.
Ensure brake levers operate smoothly.
Verify cable integrity (no cuts or fraying).
Confirm proper brake function - both front and rear.

content.heading: 2.2. 2. Tires

list.item: Tire pressure (see table below for recommended ranges).
Inspect tires for cracks, splits, or embedded objects.

content.heading: 2.2.1. Tire Pressure Guide
2.3. 3. Wheels

list.item: Spin wheels to verify smooth rotation.
Listen for unusual noises indicating bearing issues.
Inspect spokes for breakage.
Ensure spokes are tight.
Confirm axle nuts are securely tightened.
Confirm wheel is 'true' (not wobbling).

content.heading: 2.4. 4. Headset

list.item: Ensure headset bearings are tight and smooth.

content.heading: 2.5. 5. Chain

list.item: Verify easy movement of chain links.

content.heading: 2.6. 6. Handlebar & Stem
content.warning: Do *not* ride with a cracked stem.
content.heading: 2.6.1. Conditional Actions

list.item: Stem Cracked: Replace stem immediately.
Stem Loose: Tighten stem.
Handlebars Twist: Tighten clamp bolt.

Notes

list.item: This procedure is a guideline; adapt it based on specific bicycle types and rider needs.
Regular maintenance and inspection are crucial for safety and performance.
Always prioritize safety; if unsure about any component, seek professional assistance.
